ALLEGATION: Youth A was running around the house and Staff 1 shut
the door on Youth A’s leg causing injury.
INVESTIGATION:
On 10/4/21 Complainant 1 reported the incident that occurred at the agency was done
by accident.
On 10/12/21, I received an email from the PCU reporting the incident was an accident.
On 11/29/21, I interviewed Youth A face to face at the facility. Youth A reported staff
accidently shut the door on his leg when Youth A was running around the house. Youth
A reported he was upset and running around slamming the doors. Youth A reported he
was in a room and the staff was next to the door. Youth A reported the staff attempted
to shut the door and while the door was closing, he ran through the door and it hit him in
the back of his lower leg. Youth A could not remember the specific staff that shut the
door.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.158 Discipline.
(2) An institution shall prohibit all cruel and severe
discipline, including any of the following:
(a) Any type of corporal punishment inflicted in any
manner.
ANALYSIS: Both Complainant 1 and Youth A reported staff accidently shut a
door on Youth A’s leg causing a mark.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
